sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"感觉"之意。
means: feeling ： 最普通用词，既可指身体上的感觉，如冷暖、饥饿、疼痛等，又可指精神上的感觉，如喜、怒、哀、乐、失望等。
sensation系较严密的科学用词，指听觉、味觉、视觉、嗅觉或触觉；还可指引起激动或轰动的事物。
sense ： 主要指人或动物身体上的感觉。复数形式指人的知觉。
perception ： 侧重对外界刺激的反应和对产生感觉的物体的辨别。

word_mean: 感觉，知觉：由传入神经传到大脑感觉中枢的一种印象

sentence.Network_en: A sensation of burning or tingling may be experienced in the hands.
sentence.Network_cn: 双手可能会有种刺痛感或灼热感。

sentence.Network_en: The pain was so bad that she lost all sensation.
sentence.Network_cn: 太疼了，疼得她都失去了知觉。

sentence.Network_en: I find the media'sgrowing obsession with smut and sensation deplorable.
sentence.Network_cn: 我发现媒体越来越沉湎于淫秽下流和耸人听闻的题材，这实在可悲。

means.word_mean: 感觉,意识,预感,暗示,感动

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from medieval Latin sensatio(n-), from Latin sensus (see sense)

encyclopedia.content: 音乐派对 sensation 就是由世界超级巨型派对组织ID&T所推出的世界级大型DJ电音现场派对，是世界派对人士的盛会。 ID&T 推出许多派对品牌系列，其中整体效果最优的Party 就是Sensation。无论在活动理念、人数规模、舞美造型、音乐阵容方面，Sensation都是最好的。因此ID&T自豪的称 Sensation是World's Leading Dance Event，绝对名副其实。分类 Sensation每年固定在荷兰阿姆斯特丹的巨蛋举行，并分white和black两个ver

entry.def: A sensation is a physical feeling.

example.ex: Floating can be a very pleasant sensation...
example.tran: 漂浮会是一种非常惬意的感觉。

example.ex: A sensation of burning or tingling may be experienced in the hands.
example.tran: 双手可能会有种刺痛感或灼热感。

entry.def: Sensation is your ability to feel things physically, especially through your sense of touch.

example.ex: The pain was so bad that she lost all sensation.
example.tran: 太疼了，疼得她都失去了知觉。

example.ex: ...nerve damage which can lead to loss of sensation in the limbs.
example.tran: 会导致四肢麻木的神经损伤

entry.tran: (某种经历所产生的)整体感觉，总体印象
entry.def: You can use sensation to refer to the general feeling or impression caused by a particular experience.

example.ex: It's a funny sensation to know someone's talking about you in a language you don't understand.
example.tran: 知道有人正用一种你听不懂的语言谈论你，这种感觉很奇怪。

entry.tran: 引起轰动的人(或事件、情况)
entry.def: If a person, event, or situation is a sensation, it causes great excitement or interest.

example.ex: ...the film that turned her into an overnight sensation.
example.tran: 使她一夜间名声大噪的影片

entry.def: If a person, event, or situation causes a sensation, they cause great interest or excitement.

example.ex: She was just 14 when she caused a sensation at the Montreal Olympics.
example.tran: 她在蒙特利尔奥运会上引起轰动时才 14 岁。

means.word_mean: 1. an unelaborated elementary awareness of stimulation;
2. someone who is dazzlingly skilled in any field
3. a general feeling of excitement and heightened interest;

sentences.sentence: "anticipation produced in me a sensation somewhere between hope and fear"

means.word_mean: 4. a state of widespread public excitement and interest;
5. the faculty through which the external world is apprehended;

sentences.sentence: "in the dark he had to depend on touch and on his senses of smell and hearing"

auth_sentence.content: Occasionally, this sensation also occurs in the arms.
auth_sentence.res_content: Occasionally, this sensation also occurs in the arms.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Occasionally, this sensation also occurs in the arms.

auth_sentence.content: Fortunately his sensation of movement was normal on admission.
auth_sentence.res_content: Fortunately his sensation of movement was normal on admission.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Fortunately his sensation of movement was normal on admission.

auth_sentence.content: In its day, the show caused a sensation.
auth_sentence.res_content: In its day, the show caused a sensation.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In its day, the show caused a sensation.

stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+ibility具备……性质的→adj.感觉[力],敏感性

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明智的,达理的;可觉察的,明显的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+ible能……的→能感觉的→明显的
sens感觉+itive……的→adj.[to]敏感的,易受伤害的;灵敏的
non不,无+sens感觉+e→无感觉,无意义

stems_affixes.value_cn: 感觉, 感情, 感动
stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+ation表名词→n.感觉, 感情, 感动
sens感觉+e→n.感官;感觉;判断力;意义 v.觉得,意识到

stems_affixes.value_cn: 敏感, 灵敏[度], 灵敏性

stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+e→n.感官;感觉;判断力;意义 v.觉得,意识到

sentences.en: Seeing him again after so many years was a strange sensation.
sentences.cn: 那么多年以后又见到他, 是一种不可思议的感觉。

means.word_mean: 直觉；莫名其妙的感觉；经历；回忆

sentences.en: He lost all sensation in his legs through cramp.
sentences.cn: 他的腿部因抽筋而失去知觉。

means.word_mean: 激动, 轰动；哗然；引起轰动的人（或事物)

sentences.en: His unexpected success caused a sensation.
sentences.cn: 他出人意料的成功引起了轰动。

jushi.english: He lost all sensation in his legs through cramp.
jushi.chinese: 他的腿部因抽筋而失去知觉。

jushi.english: Seeing him again after so many years was a strange sensation.
jushi.chinese: 那么多年以后又见到他，是一种不可思议的感觉。

jushi.english: His unexpected success caused a sensation.
jushi.chinese: 他出人意料的成功引起了轰动。
